metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5300 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The XML parser in Expat does not use sufficient entropy for hash initialization, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted identifiers in an XML document. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-0876.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-5300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15 rodrigo-zaiden> it is also an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-6702, that followed CVE-2012-0876. libxmltok is not affected by any of these CVEs as it doesn't have the hash functions.

criterions.comment: expat package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
tla package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
